org.md2k.phonesensor

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.md2k.phonesensor.Configuration

  • public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the configuration file management for this application.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public static java.util.ArrayList<DataSource> read(android.content.Context context)
                                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads the configuration file

        The configuration file should be stored at root/mCerebrum/org.md2k.phonesensor/config.json by default.

        Parameters:
        context - Android context
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of available data sources
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when a configuration file cannot be found.

      • getMetaData

        public static DataSource getMetaData(java.lang.String dataSourceType)
        Gets the meta data for the given data source type
        Parameters:
        dataSourceType - Data source type in question
        Returns:
        The data source that corresponds to the given type

      • write

        public static void write(android.content.Context context,
                         java.util.ArrayList<DataSource> dataSources)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the list of available data sources into the configuration file.
        Parameters:
        context - Android context
        dataSources - ArrayList of available data sources
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isEqualDefault

        public static boolean isEqualDefault(android.content.Context context)
        Reads the list of data sources and default data sources and compares them.
        Parameters:
        context - Android context
        Returns:
        True as long as both files are readable and are the same

      • isConfigured

        public static boolean isConfigured()
        Checks for configuration

        Configuration is checked by reading a list of data sources. If the list is null or has no nodes then nothing was configured.

        Returns:
        Whether the ArrayList has nodes
